questions.text: What is the name of the camp Stanley goes to?
questions.explanation:
Camp Green Lake.

	There used to be a lake there, but it dried up.

questions.text: What is Stanley's nickname at the camp?
questions.explanation:
Caveman.

	'You don't mess with the Caveman.'  When the other campers say this, he thinks they are talking about the camper who was bullying him.

questions.text: What is Zero's real name?
questions.explanation:
Hector.

	The other choices are all real names of other kids at camp.  Zero's full name is Hector Zeroni.

questions.text: Who is Stanley's counselor?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Pendanski

	'Three simple words - Pen, dance, key.'  Mr. Pendanski is the counselor of D tent.

questions.text: What did Stanley go to camp for?
questions.explanation:
Stealing shoes.

	Clyde Livingston's shoes.  They were to be auctioned off to raise money for a homeless shelter.

questions.text: What is Mr. Sir addicted to since he quit smoking?
questions.explanation:
sunflower seeds.

	He eats a bag of sunflower seeds a week.

questions.text: What color clothes does Stanley have to wear at the camp?
questions.explanation:
orange.

	All the campers get two orange jumpsuits - one for work, one for leisure.

questions.text: How long do campers get in the showers?
questions.explanation:
4 minutes.

	Stanley usually goes without soaping because he won't have time.

questions.text: What does the sign on the rec room door say?
questions.explanation:
Wreck Room.

	Everything inside is trashed, from the pool table to the TV.

questions.text: Who does Zero whack with a shovel?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Pendanski

	He then walks out of the camp and into the desert.

questions.text: What is written on the boat that Stanley finds in the middle of the desert?
questions.explanation:
Mary Lou.

	It was Sam the onion man's boat.

questions.text: What was Kate Barlow's occupation before she became an outlaw?
questions.explanation:
Teacher.

	She fell in love with Sam the onion man.  Because of their racial differences and the scandal it created, Sam was killed and the schoolhouse burnt down.  She then shot the sheriff and kissed his dead body.

questions.text: Where was Stanley's great-great-grandfather from?
questions.explanation:
Latvia.

	He wanted to marry the most beautiful girl in the town, but Madame Zeroni advised that he should move to America.

questions.text: Who digs Stanley's holes for him (for a short period)?
options: He dug all his holes himself
questions.explanation:
Zero.

	Stanley taught Zero to read and Zero dug Stanley's holes.

questions.text: Who previously slept in Stanley's bed?
questions.explanation:
Barf Bag.

	Barf Bag was sent to the hospital because he stepped on a rattlesnake.

questions.text: What does Stanley do to comfort Zero as they climb the mountain?
questions.explanation:
Give him words to spell.

	His concentrating on the words gives him strength to make it up the mountains.

questions.text: Who whacks Stanley with a shovel?
questions.explanation:
Zigzag.

	Stanley's dirt was on top of Zigzag's dirt.

questions.text: Who steals the sunflower seeds?
questions.explanation:
Magnet.

	Stanley claimed that he stole the sunflower seeds, but Mr. Sir did not believe him.

questions.text: Who is Stanley's family's lawyer?
questions.explanation:
Ms. Morengo

	She comes and takes Stanley and Zero from the camp.

questions.text: Who is NOT at the party at the end of the book?
questions.explanation:
Bob.

	By the way, there was no one named Bob in the book. Sorry.
